SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at its meeting held today, viz. February 9, 2024 has considered and approved the matter given in the attached file.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at its meeting held today, viz. February 9, 2024, has considered and approved interim dividend @ 3750% i.e. Rs. 75 per equity share and special dividend @ 1250% i.e. Rs. 25 per share, taking the overall interim dividend to Rs. 100 per equity share for the financial year 2023-24, marking the centennial year of Chairman Emeritus Dr. Brijmohan Lall Munjal. Accordingly, the Board has fixed February 21, 2024 as record date for determining entitlement of members for the purpose of payment of interim and special dividend. The payment of dividend/ dispatch of dividend warrants will be completed by March 9, 2024.

SUBJECT: Dividend Updates
DETAILS: The Board of Directors at its meeting held today, viz. February 9, 2024, has considered and approved interim dividend @ 3750% i.e. Rs. 75 per equity share and a special dividend @ 1250% i.e. Rs. 25 per share, taking the overall interim dividend @ 5000% i.e. Rs. 100 per equity share for the financial year 2023-24, marking the centennial year of Chairman Emeritus Dr. Brijmohan Lall Munjal. Accordingly, the Board has fixed February 21, 2024 as record date for determining entitlement of members for the purpose of payment of interim dividend. The payment of interim dividend/ dispatch of dividend warrants will be completed by March 9, 2024.

SUBJECT: Annual General Meeting
DETAILS: We wish to inform that the 39th Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Company was held today, viz. August 9, 2022 through video conferencing (VC)/other audio visual means (OAVM). In this regard, please find enclosed the Proceedings of the AGM in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.Further, we wish to inform that the results of remote e-voting and voting done at the AGM shall be announced within stipulated time of two working days from the conclusion of meeting. The results will be displayed at the Registered Office of the Company and placed on the website of the Company, once they are declared. The results would also be placed on the website of NSDL and will be disseminated to the Stock Exchanges, i.e. BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited and be made available on their respective websites.Request you to kindly take the same on records.

SUBJECT: Shareholders meeting
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has submitted the Exchange a copy Srutinizers report of  Annual General Meeting held on August 04, 2021. Further, the company has informed the Exchange regarding voting results.We wish to inform that the 38th annual general meeting of the Company was held on August 4, 2021. In this regard, please find attached herewith the following:1. Voting Results of the annual general meeting in compliance with Regulation 44(3) of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.2. Consolidated Scrutinizer s Report in compliance with Rule 20 of Companies (Management and Administration) Rules, 2014.This is for your information and further dissemination.

SUBJECT: Shareholders meeting
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Proceedings of Annual General Meeting held on August 04, 2021.ￂﾠWe wish to inform that the 38th annual general meeting (AGM) of the Company was held today, viz. August 4, 2021 through video conferencing (VC)/other audio visual means (OAVM). In this regard, please find enclosed the Proceedings of the AGM in compliance with Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.ￂﾠFurther, we wish to inform that the results of remote e-voting and voting done at the AGM shall be announced within stipulated time of two working days from the conclusion of meeting. The results will be displayed at the Registered Office of the Company and placed on the website of the Company, once they are declared. The results would also be placed on the website of NSDL and will be disseminated to the Stock Exchanges, i.e. BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited and be made available on their respective websites.ￂﾠￂﾠThis is for your information and further dissemination.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that Record date for the purpose of DI  is 16-Feb-2021.

SUBJECT: Dividend Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange about Dividend Updates. The Board considered and declared interim dividend @3250% i.e. Rs. 65 per equity share (face value of Rs. 2 per equity share) for the financial year 2020-21. Further, the Board has also declared a special interim dividend of Rs.100 crores @250% i.e. Rs. 5 per equity share, to mark the achievement of historic milestone of achieving 100 million cumulative production of two wheelers, taking the aggregate interim dividend declared to 3500%  i.e. Rs. 70 per equity share. Accordingly, the Board has fixed February 16, 2021 as record date for determining entitlement of members for the purpose of payment of interim dividend. The payment of interim dividend/ dispatch of dividend warrants will be completed by March 6, 2021.

SUBJECT: ESOP/ESOS/ESPS
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Grant of 102935  Options.The Nomination & Remuneration Committee of the Company at its meeting held today has approved the following: 1. Grant of 1,01,375 Stock Options at an exercise price of Rs. 2,085/- per option, vesting in 4 years in the ratio of 20:20:30:30 in 4 instalments as per ESOP Plan, 2020 and 2. Grant of 1,560 Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) at face value of Rs. 2/- per unit vesting in three years in the ratio of 30:30:40 as per RSU Plan, 2020 to certain eligible employees of the Company. The RSUs are convertible into one equity share of the Company each upon vesting, subject to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Share Based Employee Benefits) Regulations, 2014 as amended from time to time and in terms of the Employee Incentive Scheme 2014.The vesting of the aforesaid Options and RSUs shall commence from the end of first year, from the date of grant. The aforesaid Options / RSUs can be exercised within seven years from the date of grant, subject to vesting thereof.Kindly take the same on records.

SUBJECT: Allotment of Securities
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding allotment of 18087 securities pursuant to ESOP/ESPS at its meeting held on October 27, 2020. This is to inform you that the Nomination & Remuneration Committee (NRC) of the Company at its meeting held today has allotted 18,087 equity shares of face value of  Rs. 2/- each to the eligible employees of the Company who have exercised their stock options under the following Plans framed under Employee Incentive Scheme 2014.Name of the Plan No. of shares allottedEmployee Stock Option Plan, 2016 4,000Employee Stock Option Plan, 2017 2,030Employee Stock Option Plan, 2018 3,294Employee Stock Option Plan, 2019 7,200Restricted Stock Units Plan, 2019 1,563Total 18,087These shares shall rank pari passu with the existing equity shares of the Company in all respects. With this allotment, the paid-up share capital of the Company has increased to Rs. 39,95,35,220 divided into 19,97,67,610 equity shares of face value of Rs. 2/- each.Kindly take the same on records.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange about Acquisition. The Board of Directors of the Company, in its meeting held on 23rd July 2020, had approved an investment of up to INR 83,99,74,176 (Rupees Eighty Three Crores Ninety Nine Lakhs Seventy Four Thousand One Hundred and Seventy Six), in one or more tranches, in Ather Energy Private Limited through Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares.  Post this investment, the shareholding of Hero MotoCorp Ltd in Ather Energy Private Limited will increase from 35.10% (31.27% on a fully diluted basis) to 38.57% (34.58% on a fully diluted basis). The investment is subject to execution of definitive documents and completion of certain conditions customary to a transaction of this nature.  The requisite information is disclosed in the Annexure.This is for your information and further dissemination.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Company Update'.This is further to our press release dated March 22, 2020 wherein we had communicated the decision to halt operations till March 31, 2020, at all our manufacturing plants globally to maintain the health and well‐being of employees, due to escalating COVID‐19 situation.In this regard, we wish to update that in view of the various directives issued by the Central Government /concerned State Governments relating to lockdown and the need for social distancing, the operations at our plants in India will continue to remain suspended beyond March 31, 2020 until April 14, 2020.The Business Continuity Task Force set‐up in this regard is constantly monitoring the evolving situation through regular video conferencing and tele‐meetings to ensure that organisational safety and business plans are up‐to‐date and effective.This is for your information and records please.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Company Update'.With reference to the cited subject, we wish to inform as under: The ongoing issue of Coronavirus (Covid-19) in China has affected the supply of some components to our manufacturing facilities in India. This is likely to impact our planned production by around 10% for the month of February. However, the wholesale dispatches of our vehicles to the dealers during the month remain unaffected. Any further impact on our production will depend on the developing situation in China. We continue to track the developments and keep evaluating our options. This is submitted for your information and records.

SUBJECT: ESOP/ESOS/ESPS
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Grant of 115210  Options. The Nomination & Remuneration Committee of the Company at its meeting held today has approved the following: 1. Grant of 1,10,000 Stock Options at an exercise price of Rs. 1,745 per option, vesting in 4 years in the ratio of 20:20:30:30 in 4 instalments as per ESOP Plan, 2019 and2. Grant of 5,210 Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) at face value of Rs. 2/- per unit vesting in three years in the ratio of 30:30:40 as per RSU Plan, 2019 to certain eligible employees of the Company. The RSUs are convertible into one equity share of the Company each upon vesting, subject to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Share Based Employee Benefits) Regulations, 2014 as amended from time to time and in terms of the Employee Incentive Scheme 2014.The vesting of the aforesaid Options and RSUs shall commence from the end of first year, from the date of grant. The aforesaid Options / RSUs can be exercised within seven years from the date of grant, subject to vesting thereof. Kindly take the same on records.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that With reference to the cited subject, we wish to inform that over the past few days, Hero MotoCorp Ltd. has noticed a few reports in news media, stating "Hero MotoCorp has participated in fundraising for an e-mobility Startup Blu Smart Mobility". Hero MotoCorp Ltd. strongly denies any such participation and / or any investment made in Blu Smart Mobility. Further, it is clarified that Hero MotoCorp neither released any media report related to Blu Smart Mobility nor was consulted for the same by any agency or person. Hero MotoCorp Ltd. reserves its right to initiate appropriate legal action against any entity/agency that indulges in spreading false information about the Company. This is submitted for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Disclosure under Regulation 30 of SEBI Listing Regulations'.We write in furtherance to our letter dated July 25, 2018 (enclosed as Annexure A) wherein we informed about the investment of INR 130,00,04,640 (Rupees One Hundred and Thirty Crore Four Thousand Six Hundred and Forty only) to be made by the Company in Ather Energy Private Limited (ￂﾓAtherￂﾔ) through compulsorily convertible debentures (ￂﾓCCDsￂﾔ). At the time of the abovementioned disclosure, the post investment shareholding percentage of the Company in Ather was not determined, as it was to be based on the valuation of Ather in the next funding round. In this regard, we wish to inform that the next funding round of Ather has now been completed and simultaneous with the completion of this round, the CCDs issued to the Company have been converted into compulsorily convertible preference shares (ￂﾓCCPSￂﾔ). Post the aforesaid corporate actions, the shareholding of the Company in Ather, has increased to 35.10% (31.27% on a fully diluted basis) from 32.31% (29.94% on a fully diluted basis). This is submitted for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that we wish to submit our response to the query sought by stock exchanges as detailed hereunder: Query: In the press release issued by the Company on May 3, 2018, the sales number for April, 2017 was mentioned as 5,95,706, whereas the number for the said month was reported as 5,91,306 in the press release dated May 1, 2017. Company's Response: The Company commenced the production at its manufacturing facility in Bangladesh in the month of May 2017. Company's exports to Bangladesh therefore, transitioned from April 2017, to different codes in SAP. Since this was the first month of the system transition, the entire process of capturing the total data on Company's Internal SAP System took longer than usual. Therefore, the sales numbers of April 2017 issued to the stock exchanges showed a lesser number than the actual number of vehicles sold during the month. This was rectified soon after, and the correct figure was incorporated into the system, which is what reflects in the communication to the Media and the stock exchanges on May 3, 2018.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Hero MotoCorp Limited (the ￂﾓCompanyￂﾔ) through its wholly owned subsidiary, HMCL Netherlands B.V. (ￂﾓHMCL BVￂﾔ), entered into a joint venture agreement in 2014 (as subsequently amended from time to time) and certain ancillary agreements inter alia, for sale, distribution and marketing of the Companyￂﾒs products in Colombia. The joint venture is being implemented through a joint venture company incorporated in Colombia, i.e. HMCL Colombia S.a.S (the ￂﾓJVCￂﾔ). Pursuant to subsequent investment by HMCL BV into the share capital of the JVC, the equity interests/shareholding of the joint venture partners in the JVC have been re-aligned whereby the Companyￂﾒs equity interest/shareholding in the JVC (through HMCL BV) has increased to 68% (Sixty Eight percent), on a fully diluted basis, from 51% (Fifty One percent); and the other joint venture partnerￂﾒs equity interest/shareholding in the JVC, held through Woven Holdings LLC (a company incorporated in accordance with the laws of State of Delaware, U.S.A.), has decreased to 32% (Thirty Two percent), on a fully diluted basis, from 49% (Forty Nine percent).  Kindly take the same on your records'.

('the firm ') was constituted on 27 March 1 990 having firm registration no. 101248W. It  was converted into limited liability partnership i.e. B S R & Co. LLP on 14 October 2013 with firm registration no. 1 0 I248W / W-1 00022. The registered office of the firm is at 5th  Floor, Lodha Excelus, Apollo Mills Compound , N. M. Joshi Marg, Mahalaxmi, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400 011 .B S R & Co. LLP is a member entity of B S R & Affiliates, a network registered with the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. The other entities which are part of the B S R & Affiliates include B S R & Associates LLP, B S R & Company, B S R and Co, B S R and Associates, B S R and Company, B S R R & Co, B S S R & Co and B B S R & Co.B S R & Co. LLP is registered in Mumbai, Gurgaon, Bangalore, Kolkata, Hyderabad,Pune, Chennai, Chandigarh, Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Noida and Kochi.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated August 16, 2016 that "This has reference to our letter dated July 27, 2016 regarding realignment of business interests amongst the promoters of Hero Motorcorp Limited ("Company"). In this context, kindly note the following:(1). Mr. Sunil Kant Munjal's tenure as Joint Managing Director of the Company ends today, i.e., August 16, 2016. He has also resigned from the Board of Directors of the Company with effect from the same date.(2). In addition, we have received a communication from the individual promoters of the Company stating that pursuant to the aforesaid realignment, Mr. Sunil Kant Munjal will henceforth, not be classified as a "promoter" of the Company. However, Mr. Sunil Kant Munjal will continue to hold 32,500 equity shares of the Company representing 0.02% of the issued and paid up share capital of the Company in his individual capacity. Further, please note that there will be no change in classification of the remaining promoters and such persons will continue to be promoters of the Company. The above realignment will also not have any impact on the overall shareholding of the promoters and promoter group, collectively in the Company".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that "keeping with the core values of the Hero Group as established by the late Dr. Brijmohan Lall Munjal, the members of the BML Munjal family have decided to realign their businesses to achieve future growth and expansion. With the blessings of Smt. Santosh Munjal, the matriarch of the Munjal family, Mr. Sunil Kant Munjal, Joint Managing Director, Hero MotoCorp, and Chairman, Hero Corporate Service, intends to focus his time and energy on his independent and core businesses, and to pursue new business interests. He has, therefore, expressed his desire to step down from the Board of Directors of Hero MotoCorp, once his tenure as the Joint Managing Director of the Company comes to an end on August 16, 2016. We, at Hero MotoCorp, are grateful for his contribution during his tenure as Joint Managing Director and wish him success in his new endeavours. This realignment will not impact the overall promoter shareholding, strategic direction or operational management of the Company. On this occasion, Mr Pawan Munjal, Chairman, Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer, and the Senior Leadership Team at Hero MotoCorp reiterate their commitment to continue to build our organisation into a truly world class enterprise in all respects. We will continue to work in the best interest of all stakeholders of Hero MotoCorp, including shareholders, employees, suppliers and business associates".

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company through its wholly owned subsidiary, HMCL Netherlands B.V. ( HMCL BV ), entered into a joint venture agreement in 2014 (as subsequently amended from time to time) and certain ancillary agreements (collectively the Transaction Documents ), inter alia, for sale, distribution and marketing of the Company s products in Colombia. The joint venture is being implemented through a joint venture company incorporated in Colombia (the JVC ). In terms of the Transaction Documents, the equity interests of the shareholders in the JVC have been re-aligned whereby the Company (through HMCL BV) is holding 51% (Fifty One percent) of equity interest in the JVC and the remaining 49% (Forty Nine percent) of equity interest in the JVC is being held by Woven Holdings LLC (a company incorporated in accordance with the laws of State of Delaware, U.S.A.).

SUBJECT: News Clarification

In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement. The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that the meeting of Board of Directors ( Board )to be held on May 7, 2015. The Company wish to inform that the Board in its said meeting has considered and approved setting up of an operating wholly owned subsidiary ( WOS  ) in United States of America for conducting the business of, amongst others, providing research, development and consulting services, distribution, marketing and promotion of two wheeler vehicles, and any other ancillary activities. This could also entail purchase of assets for establishing the business. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated January 6, 2015 regarding following two media statements - "The auto industry still remains sluggish, and therefore, the rollback of the current excise duty rate is going to adversely impact the industry in particular and the manufacturing sector in general. Manufacturers have no option but to pass on the enhanced excise duty rates to customers which is going to further slowdown the pace of growth in the industry. We have raised the prices on our two-wheelers to offset the increased duty impact. The new prices have come into effect from January 1st."  "The transporters' strike January 6, 2015 has impacted the despatches from our plants in Gurgaon and Dharuhera. We could despatch only half of our average daily despatches from these two plants January 6, 2015. We are trying to make alternative arrangements to minimize further impact. We hope the authorities and the Automobile Carrier Welfare Association (ACWA) will be able to resolve the issue amicably at the earliest."

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hero MotoCorp Limited has informed the Exchange that Hero MotoCorp Ltd. (HMCL), on September 16, 2014 has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the State Government of Andhra Pradesh to set-up a manufacturing plant in Chittoor district in state of Andhra Pradesh. The plant with an investment of Rs .1600 crores approx. will have a production capacity of around 1.8 million p.a.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Hero MotoCorp Limited with respect to a news item captioned "Hero MotoCorp to set up plant in Andhra for Rs. 2,200 crore". The Company has clarified that "The news item seems to be based on the statement made by Andhra Pradesh Government. The Company is neither aware of any such statement nor the statement has been made by the Company or with the consent of the Company; and that the negotiations in this regard are under way and nothing has been finalised as yet. Further no agreement has been executed in this regard. For that matter, the Company keep on discussing such options with various State Governments and unless finalised there is no point of making any premature disclosure. However as and when any agreement with any government is finalised, the same will be brought to the knowledge of the exchange."

DETAILS: Hero Honda Motors Ltd. has informed the Exchange regarding a press release, dated, May 30, 2006, titled "Hero Honda Motors reports Financial Results for the Year 2005-06" The details of the press release shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements).

SUBJECT: Strike
DETAILS: Hero Honda Motors Ltd. had informed the Exchange regarding raising of demand by a section of workers hired by contractors on their contractors and irresponsibly stopping the work. The Company has now informed the Exchange that due to responsible corporate practices being followed by the Company and extension of full cooperation to all concerned parties - the Government agencies, the contractors and their workers, the above matter has been resolved amicably and production has resumed at the plant.

SUBJECT: Strike
DETAILS: Hero Honda Motors Ltd. has informed the Exchange that a section of workers hired by contractors have raised demands on their contractors and have irresponsibly stopped working. The Company has always been following responsible corporate practices. For an early resolution, the COmpany is extending full cooperation to all concerned parties - the Government agencies, the contractors and their workers and are hope full to achieve an amicable solution very soon.

SUBJECT: Change in shareholding
DETAILS: Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Limited has informed the Exchange that accounts managed or advised by them own a total of 13,959,300 shares in Hero Honda Motors Ltd. following a sale of 62,000 shares on June 28,2005. The details of sale are as follows: Aberdeen Asset Management Asia - Segregated Funds has sold 62,000 shares aggregating to 0.0310% of the share capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd.. The shareholding of funds advised/managed by Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Limited after the said sale is as follows: 1) Aberdeen International Asia Pacific Fund-1,200,000 shares; 2) Aberdeen International India Opportunities-5,265,000 shares; 3) Aberdeen International Emerging Markets Fund-75,000 shares; 4) Aberdeen Global Asia Pacific Fund-1,800,000 shares; 5) Aberdeen Emerging Markets Fund-350,000 shares; 6) Aberdeen Far East Emerging Economies Unit Trust-1,450,000 shares; 7) Aberdeen Asia Pacific Unit Trust-110,000 shares; 8) Aberdeen Global Emerging Markets Fund-30,000 shares; 9) Edinburgh Dragon Trust PLC-750,000 shares; 10) New India Investment Company (Mauritius) Ltd-545,000 shares; 11) Aberdeen Asset Management Asia-Segregated Funds-2,384,300 shares. The aggregate shareholding of Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Ltd on behalf of funds advised/managed after the said sale is 13,959,300 shares aggregating to 6.9906% of the share capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd..

SUBJECT: Date of AGM/Book Closure
DETAILS: Hero Honda Motors Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company has decided to close its Register of Members and Share Transfer Books from July 22, 2005 to July 27, 2005 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of AGM and ascertaining the entitlement of members for payment of a dividend @ 1000% i.e. Rs.20 per equity share of Rs.2 each for the financial year 2004-05. The Company has further informed that AGM of the Company is scheduled to be held on August 22, 2005.

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Ltd has informed the Exchange that they on behalf of funds advised/managed, have acquired 82,000 shares aggregating to 0.0411% of the share capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd. The mode of acquisition is through open market purchase and the date of acquisition is June 02, 2005. The shareholding of Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Ltd on behalf of funds advised/managed after the said acquisition is 13,987,300 shares aggregating to 7.0046% of the share capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd..

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The media had reports that Hero Honda Motors Limited might declare a bonus. Further, the company is likely to get huge tax rebates on its proposed plant, likely to be set-up in Uttaranchal State with a capacity of 1 million motorcycles a year at an investment of around 2.5 billion rupees. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Hero Honda Motors Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "In this connection, we would like to comment that at the moment Company is not considering any issue of bonus shares. Further, Company is yet to finalise the proposal for third manufacturing plant. Various options are being examined and no final decision have been taken so far. As and when the decision will be taken the same will be comminicated to the Stock Exchanges and public at large".

SUBJECT: Reg.13-SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading Regulations)1992
DETAILS: Hero Honda Motors Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Life Insurance Corporation of India has acquired 1201050 shares of the company representing 0.60% of the paid up capital of the company. The date of acquisition is October 15, 2004 and the mode of acquisition is off market deal. Consequent to the said acquisition the shareholding of Life Insurance Corporation of India has exceeded the limit of 5% of the equity capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd on October 15, 2004.

SUBJECT: Disc under SEBI(Subs Acqui. of shares &takeovers) Reg 1997
DETAILS: Aberdeen Asset Management Asia Ltd has informed the Exchange that they have acquired 413,000 shares amounting to 0.2069% of the total paid up capital of Hero Honda Motors Ltd. The mode of acquisition is through open market purchase and the date of acquisition is October 05, 2004.
